title-group.article-title: THE ROLE OF AGRICULTURAL CREDIT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF AGRICULTURAL SECTOR: THE NIGERIAN CASE

abstract.p: This paper examines the impact of agricultural credit on agricultural production in Nigeria between 1970 and 2001, by adopting the production-production externality approach. It is revealed, as part of the findings, that agricultural credit is an important factor determining growth of agricultural production and development. But given the short-term nature of credit provision of the banking system, in the face of long gestation period for agricultural production, the paper advocates for a policy reorientation that accords greater attention to policy strategies and resource allocation to agriculture, which has the potentials and capabilities of leading the economy to greater growth heights.
